p: Bai et al. conducted an in vivo study on male Sprague–Dawley rats, focused on investigating the effect of betulinic acid on lipopolysaccharide-induced vascular hyporeactivity on an aortic contraction-relaxation model [ 38]. Betulinic acid downregulated the pro-inflammatory factors TNF-α and IL-1β triggered by the LPS treatment thus exhibiting a potent anti-inflammatory effect.
